rotate.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to turn with a circular movement around a central point, or to make something do this
rotate.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours.
Rotate the pan halfway through the baking time.
rotate.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if a job rotates, or if people rotate jobs, they each do a particular job for a particular period of time
rotate.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The chairmanship of the committee rotates annually.
Employers may rotate duties to give staff wider experience.
rotate.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to change the places of things or people, or to change places, especially in a circular direction
rotate.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Rotating the tyres every few months helps them last longer.
rotate.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to regularly change the crops grown on a piece of land, in order to preserve the quality of the soil
rotate.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if a job rotates, or if people rotate jobs, they each do the jobs for a fixed period of time, one after the other
rotate.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Within each section of the company, workers are now rotated from job to job regularly.
The chairmanship of the committee rotates annually.
